intro: Draba majuscula, commonly known as the large whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces a single, upright flowering stem. Draba majuscula is often found in open habitats such as tundra, meadows, and mountain slopes.
